body.description: Distinctive cards make a statement Understated design is appropriate for many occasions A symbol of transformation, the dragonfly has long inspired creative spirits, such as Art Nouveau designer Louis Comfort Tiffany. Exceptional value Premium boxed set features crisp, clean note cards of substantial stock and stationery envelopes constructed of quality paper. Brighten someone's day Stay in touch with a personal handwritten note.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: When only a personal note will do Delight your recipients with our Blue Dragonflies Note Card!

Premium boxed stationery set comes with 14 note cards and 15 envelopes Elegant design, gorgeous detail Jewel-tone dragonflies grace this gorgeous card. Subtle gold foil highlights imbue a luminous effect. Raised embossing lends dimension. A delicate blue and gold foil border surrounds the design. Textured linen finish is pleasing to the touch. Superior card stock Inside, superior smooth-finish card stock takes pen beautifully. No smudging or streaking. No gel pens required. Card interiors are blank for your personal message. Classic ivory envelopes included Stationery envelopes are made of quality paper.

Distinctive cards make a statement Understated design is appropriate for many occasions A symbol of transformation, the dragonfly has long inspired creative spirits, such as Art Nouveau designer Louis Comfort Tiffany. Exceptional value Premium boxed set features crisp, clean note cards of substantial stock and stationery envelopes constructed of quality paper. Brighten someone's day Stay in touch with a personal handwritten note. About our Blue Dragonflies Note Cards Set comes with 14 folded note cards with blank interiors 15 ivory stationery envelopes Cards measure 5'' wide x 3-1/2'' high Stationery set comes in a designer box with a clear acetate lid
Black Cat Note Cards Dragonfly Note Cards Owl Forest Note Cards Owl Portrait Note Cards Watercolor Birds Note Cards Bird Garden Note Cards

Our Company History In 1928, at the age of twenty-two, Peter Beilenson began printing books on a small press in the basement of his parents’ home in Larchmont, New York. Peter - and later, his wife, Edna - sought to create fine books that sold at prices even a pauper could afford. Today, still family owned and operated, Peter Pauper Press continues to honor our founders’ legacy - and our customers’ expectations - of beauty, quality, and value. Image: Peter Pauper Press headquarters, Mount Vernon, New York, circa 1948.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars QUALITY PRODUCT, VERY PLEASED
reviews.reviewText: The quality card stock, beautiful format, soft color tints, self-sealing pull tape tab on the envelope. Everything about this stationary speaks quality of the highest standard. So very pleased.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Note cards with universal appeal. David Cole Wheeler artwork Delight the people in your life!
reviews.reviewText: These are wonderful! Very subtle artwork on a linen-like matte finish on the front AND back. There is an oh so right frame around the dragonflies. They look expensive. I'm a little particular about paper and ink on personal correspondence looking cheap. It seems as time marches on the things sent in the mail are on nothing special paper and written with a blue ballpoint pen. Horrible! I caught myself getting into the habit of doing that as well, buying cards at Marshalls or a discount store and writing with a ballpoint pen. It doesn't have to be that way when card sets like these from Peter Pauper Press are handly. I also use a uni-ball Signo pen and my notes come out so much nicer, and I am never caught in a pinch. I like to show respect for the people who get my notes and this is a way to get it done. Blank inside is the way to go. The upper inside of the note has an indentation where the artwork was stamped, which matters only if you intend to write on it. You don't get that on note cards which cost $80 a boxl. Also the illustrator is top notch although much of his work is children's books. You will not be sorry for buying these and treat yourself to a pack of these pens while you are at it. They cost $1-2 dollars each and come in other colors, refillable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful imprint. Great paper quality.
reviews.reviewText: I love the paper and I love the dragonfly imprint. It is beautiful.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lovely design and card stock is substantial
reviews.reviewText: The color, artwork, quality are all there, very pleased with purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Pretty, Good Quality, Clean Bright Foiling
reviews.reviewText: The card stock is a good thickness. The foiling is bright and shiny, not cheap looking. Pretty design! Great Price!! Thanks!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Beautiful and elegant in the simplicity of the design. The perfect size for those occasions when you'd rather not say too much.Sometimes a whisper imparts more; these little note cards will do just that.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Pretty and Classy design
reviews.reviewText: I like the simplicity of these cards and the quality is good. The only reason I gave it four stars instead of five is that the box had large pieces of tape holding the lid on and they were sloppily applied (uneven and wrinkled). The clear plastic lid fits snuggly inside the box so I'm not sure why the tape was needed. If I was giving this as a gift I would have needed to remove the tape and clean off the sticky residue left behind first. Peter Pauper Press seems to use tape this way on a lot of their products and it just makes the presentation more tacky (no pun intended).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars More Beautiful than the Picture
reviews.reviewText: The pictures don’t capture the magic and sparkle of the shiny ink on the wings and body and encircling the card. High quality thick card stock. I am just thrilled with how pretty and special these cards are and immediately am thinking who to write to. I think whoever gets one of these will be charmed.

These Blue Dragonfly Note Cards are very cute, and nice to have handy. I can use them for anything. I love dragonflies, and my friends know it, so they aren't surprised to see a dragonfly on my cards to them. I also love that these are blue, as that is my favourite colour. I am so happy with these cards.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Nice design; not so big that you don't know how to start writing!
Beautiful notecards on heavy stock with delicate embossing. Well worth the purchase!
Cards are really pretty and delivery was earlier than expected.

These dragonfly note cards are made of sturdy paper stock and are beautifully drawn.Conveniently priced for someone who isn't getting out to shop these days. Amazon offers a large selection of well designed blank cards suitable for all occasions.
